Package com.passwordmanager.security

Class PBKDF2Hasher

java.lang.Object
com.passwordmanager.security.PBKDF2Hasher
public final class PBKDF2Hasher extends Object
Utility class for hashing passwords and deriving keys using PBKDF2 (HMAC-SHA256).

Cryptographic Lifecycle:

  • Hashing â€“ For password authentication (stored hash comparison)
  • Verification â€“ For validating user-entered passwords against stored hashes
  • Key Derivation â€“ For generating session keys used in encryption/decryption

All sensitive data (passwords, derived keys) are cleared from memory immediately after use wherever possible to reduce exposure.

Security Guarantees:

  • Salts are cryptographically random (128-bit minimum)
  • Iteration count meets OWASP recommendations (600,000+)
  • Derived keys are 256-bit for AES-256 compatibility
  • All intermediate key material is zeroized after use

  • Method Details

    • generateSalt

      public static byte[] generateSalt()
      Generates a cryptographically secure random salt.
      Returns:
      a byte array containing a randomly generated salt

    • hashPassword

      public static HashedPassword hashPassword(char[] password, byte[] salt, int iterations) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException
      Hashes a password using PBKDF2 with the specified salt and iteration count.

      This method is used for authentication purposes only. The resulting hash should be stored and used for password verification via verifyPassword(char[], com.passwordmanager.security.HashedPassword).

      Security Note: The password is cleared from the PBEKeySpec after hashing, but the caller is responsible for clearing the input char[] array.

      Parameters:
      password - the password to hash (char array)
      salt - the salt to use for hashing
      iterations - the number of PBKDF2 iterations (minimum 100,000 recommended)
      Returns:
      a HashedPassword containing the algorithm, iterations, salt, and hash
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256 is not available
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - if password is null/empty, salt is null, or iterations < 1

    • defaultHashPassword

      public static HashedPassword defaultHashPassword(char[] password) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException
      Hashes a password using default salt and iteration constants.

      Equivalent to calling hashPassword(char[], byte[], int) with a freshly generated salt and 600000 iterations.

      Parameters:
      password - the password to hash
      Returns:
      a HashedPassword with default parameters
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256 is not available
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - if password is null or empty

    • verifyPassword

      public static boolean verifyPassword(char[] password, HashedPassword stored) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException
      Verifies whether a password matches a previously stored HashedPassword.

      This method performs a constant-time comparison of the derived hash to prevent timing attacks. However, note that PBKDF2's high iteration count already makes timing attacks impractical in most scenarios.

      Parameters:
      password - the password to verify
      stored - the stored hashed password to check against
      Returns:
      true if the password matches, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256 is not available
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - if password or stored is null

    • deriveSessionKey

      public static byte[] deriveSessionKey(char[] password, HashedPassword stored) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, InvalidKeySpecException
      Derives raw key bytes from a password and a stored HashedPassword, suitable for vault session or encryption use.

      Critical Security Note: This method is intended for key derivation, NOT password verification. The derived key should be:

      • Used immediately to unlock the vault session
      • Never persisted to disk
      • Zeroized from memory when the session ends

      The caller MUST clear the returned byte array using Arrays.fill(key, (byte) 0) when finished.

      Parameters:
      password - the password to derive the key from
      stored - the stored hashed password providing salt and iterations
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the derived session key (256 bits)
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if PBKDF2WithHmacSHA256 is not available
      InvalidKeySpecException - if the key specification is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - if password or stored is null
